intro: Willoughbya buddlejifolia, commonly known as the rock fig, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It is a small, woody shrub that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough or hairy texture. Willoughbya buddlejifolia is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal heathlands.
